acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: From a description of LDLo value of 2,000 mg/kg (RTECS (2006)) in the dermal administration test employing rabbits, it was classified into Category 5.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a liquid by the definition of GHS, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: The LDLo value of 6-hour inhalation administration test employing rats is 63 mg/L (4-hour equivalent: 77 mg/L (20,933 ppm)) (RTECS (2006)). Since saturated vapor pressure level (20degC) is 81,000 ppm (299 mg/L), it is over the range of Category 4 when classifying according to the gas classification, and classification is not possible because it cannot be judged if LD50 is Category 5 or "Not classified". EU-Annex I: R20 is equivalent to the GHS Category 3-4.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was classified into Category 5 from LD50 value 2,525 mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2005)) of the oral administration test employing a mouse.

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since the gene mutation test or UDS test employing the CHO cell in vitro do not show toxicity but toxicity is shown in SCE test employing a CHO cell, there is a possibility of chromosomal aberration in the test employing mammalian cultured cells (PATTY (5th, 2005)). However, since there was no data of in vivo examination, it was considered that classification is not possible.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since deformation in fetuses' fingers were observed in the developmental toxicity study via oral administration using mice at the dose level where general toxicity was not found in parent animals using mice and increase in fetal death was observed (PATTY(5th,2005)) at the dose level where general toxicity was not found in parent animals in the developmental study via forced oral administration using rats, it was classified in Category 1B. EU-Annex I is Cat. 2; R60/R61, corresponding to GHS Category 1B.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although it has been described that the impact on avoidance reaction and the growth reduction are seen in 10 days inhalation administration test employing rats (1,000 ppm, 4hr/day) (PATTY (5th, 2005)), since the exposure periods are shorter than 14 days which are provided in the technical indicator , it was determined that classification is not possible due to insufficient information.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since there is a description that inhalation exposure causes conditions, such as giddiness and breathing difficulty, and oral exposure causes nausea and atypical absence in humans (HSDB (2002)), it was classified into Category 3 (Narcotic effects)
